contributors.headline: Senior Full Stack Developer at POAP - The Proof Of Attendance Protocol

projects.title: Gamified eLearning system for IT students
projects.description:
One of the 2Sides partners wanted to experiment with 2-learning environments in classrooms. I offered to make a prototype that could be used to evaluate the effectiveness in a number of classes in the programming and network management fields.

I chose WordPress combines with LearnDash as the backend modules to make the system easy to handle for other educational staff.

The results of using this system were rather interesting. A great advantage of working with a system like this is the self-pacing of students, which prevented the classroom inherent issue of different learning speeds.

The gamification component of the system centered mostly around experience points and badge systems. The response to these was rather positive and resulted in higher engagement rates.

projects.title: Ninjamask Security
projects.description:
A non-profit VPN project. I started this mostly to help out friends and family in need of a free VPN connection.

Setting up and managing this project has allowed me to streamline my knowledge of VPN infrastructure and the management of larger groups of customers.

It proved to me that running a zero-tracking VPN project is entirely viable.

contributors.headline: Senior Full Stack Developer at POAP - The Proof Of Attendance Protocol

projects.title: Skill Collector Blog
projects.description:
While it is a great outlet for spontaneous creativity, I generally post articles every 1 or 2 months. Since they are big articles the readership is steady.

Skill Collector is a blog aimed at presenting awesome skills. The goal is to stimulate people to learn more than one trade, or at least have some side-skills.

I view this blog as a place where I can structure my thoughts on particular topics. Explaining things to other people is a great way to learn, and I view blogging at SC to be a great way to facilitate this process.

contributors.headline: Senior Full Stack Developer at POAP - The Proof Of Attendance Protocol

projects.title: Collaboration with 2Sides
projects.description:
Through freelance engagements I came into contact with 2Sides, who train and hire out trainers and educational specialists.

Working with the 2Sides customers is a wonderfully educational and exciting experience. As an affiliated freelancer I'm responsible for developing and organising classes and trainings in a number of technology fields.

Examples of subject areas I'm hired for:

- Web programming languages (HTML/CSS/JS/PHP/Ruby)
- Web application infrastructure
- Project development and management
- Entrepreneurship
- Personal development

This project gives me great insight into developing educational products as well as making relatively traditional and rigid organisations deal with rapid technological change.

contributors.headline: Senior Full Stack Developer at POAP - The Proof Of Attendance Protocol

projects.title: UCM Summary Dropbox initiative
projects.description:
During my time as a student at University College Maastricht I started and managed a Dropbox summary system with a couple of hundred people.

The goal was to share summaries between students to make studying easier. It worked great.

I linked an email marketing tool to Dropbox and a number of backup services to make it easier to manage.

contributors.headline: Senior Full Stack Developer at POAP - The Proof Of Attendance Protocol

projects.title: BlueVPN (Sold)
projects.description:
BlueVPN is a VPN privacy service. I sold it after it got out of hand and distracted from other projects.

The project started as an attempt to put together a number of skills into a concrete project.

The success factor in the business in my opinion was offering free accounts in exchange for social media shares. That combined with technology to offer encrypted connections cheaply allowed the business to grow rapidly.

From a learning perspective it was very valuable to deal with setting up VPN infrastructure on a industrial scale. Additionally working with a large pool of customers proved a very educational experience.

projects.title: Kairos Society Maastricht
projects.description:
The Kairos Society is an international student-run not-for-profit foundation world-wide based. We started with the belief that the key to improving our world lies in uniting the next generation of leaders to develop globally impactful innovations. To this end, Kairos has built a member base consisting of some of the brightest students from top universities around the world. Along with guidance from some of today’s foremost leaders, these students are working together to use entrepreneurship and innovation in tackling some of today’s most daunting issues including alternative energy, education, and health. Kairos members hold a common belief that they will ultimately Do Well by Doing Good.

The Kairos Society moved away from the hub/ambassador structure in favor of a centralized approach.

company.name: POAP - The Proof of Attendance Protocol

profile_positions.company: POAP - The Proof of Attendance Protocol
profile_positions.description: Leading a small team that takes businesses needs and makes products for them. Usually trying to make web3 products that are easy to use for web2 users. Often for web, never without end-to-end tests.
profile_positions.title: Senior Full Stack Developer

profile_positions.description: Generous VPN is a freemium VPN service. I developed and manage the entire project including server setup (and maintenance) and the website that manages signups and orders.
profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description: Building a wide variety of applications for large corporate clients and smaller parties. Often using react (native), sometimes using firebase, always using a CI pipeline.
profile_positions.title: Senior Full Stack Developer

profile_positions.description: My role is to plan the architecture of the solution as well as oversee the development and deployment of market testing apps. This involves strategic planning as well as the operational aspect of working with other developers.
profile_positions.title: Chief Technology Officer

profile_positions.description: The EME company seeks to facilitate a circular economy by the creation of a resources passport system for products and a marketplace for excess and waste materials. My responsibilities included the managing of an external development initiative as well as building and deploying a full-stack prototype of the resources passport.
profile_positions.title: Interim Technical Lead

company.name: The New York Code + Design Academy

profile_positions.description:
I taught the 3 month full-time BSSA program program which takes 20 young unemployed people and within 3 months turns them into full stack NodeJS developers.

The stack I taught the students:

- Backend: NodeJS, Express with Pug, Postgres with Sequelize
- Frontend: Vanilla mostly. Some React & Angular

I also rewrote the curriculum to follow a group-based problem based learning approach. This allowed for better skill development both in the primary area of programming as well as secondary skills such as communicating abstract concepts and analysing novel problems.
profile_positions.title: Lead instructor

profile_positions.description: I taught web technologies and infrastructure. I was also involved in curriculum design for the entire institution. The web technologies centered around frontend (HTML/CSS/JS), backend (PHP, SQL) and infrastructure (Linux, Virtualisation etc).
profile_positions.title: Instructor

company.name: AMISET "Does your body need a friend?"

profile_positions.description:
Over the course of a year, I advised and/or managed a number of changes, including:

- Creating a mobile friendly eCommerce platform
- Planning online marketing budgets
- Determining online marketing strategies
- Creating product specific marketing campaigns

My deepest interest in this company was for the products. In this area I contributed to:

- Researching scientific findings useful for new products
- Confirming the science behind current products
- Making sure our products were in accordance with legislation
profile_positions.title: Web and Strategy Developer

profile_positions.description:
Hoasted started as a way for two of my friends to serve their freelance (webdesign) customers better. Over time it grew to be a large enough project to demand a full time focus.

Working on Hoasted taught me a lot about web infrastructure and the development of software platforms.

I became involved when the project was still small and helped it grow towards a profitable business. For a number of months I worked on it full time, but decided to focus on other projects.
profile_positions.title: Developer & Partner

profile_positions.description:
As a result of 3 Day Startup Maastricht I together with a number of other participants developed a product called CleanPC. It was a USB stick that contained a 1-click computer maintenance solution. I went into this project knowing nothing about starting, running or growing a company.

Over a number of years I gained experience in project management, working with Chinese manufacturers and doing business with big retail chains. The most successful moment of the project in my view was selling CleanPC at the Media Markt (one of the biggest technology retailers in the Netherlands at the time) in Maastricht.

The project did not end up as a commercial success, but was a great learning experience. My experiences in this project have helped a lot in my professional life.
profile_positions.title: Cofounder
